CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities. Skills and attributes for success: Develop, manage, and document a workflow process to identify, archive, and delete materials according to the requisite destruction/deletion policy and in accordance with Division, Department, and NARA instruction/policy. On smaller projects, may perform the entire range of technical support, including program validations and testing, etc. Performs systems evaluations. Reports on contract and task order progress. Directs and supervises personnel assigned to perform on-task orders, ensuring conformance to work standards and ensuring that the technical design conforms to functional requirements. Must demonstrate substantial, hands-on, successful experience in actually doing the work on the systems being used, usually at least five years of such experience. Requires broad knowledge of the Government's IT environments, including office automation networks, and PC and server-based databases and applications. Experience in a litigation support environment is extremely helpful. Excellent oral and written communication skills are required. Supervisory experience is very strongly preferred. The ability to lead a technical team, and to give it direction, will be very important, as will the demonstrated ability to analyze the attorneys' needs and to design and implement a whole system solution responsive to those needs. LOCATION OF WORK: Division of Administration, Office of Technology Services. Differs from IT Statewide Applications Senior Developer 2 by the absence of responsibility for developing complex information technology applications. Examples of Work This is a full-time, on-site position located in the Greater Baton Rouge area. The Office of Technology Services aims to be a responsible partner in delivering innovative, effective, and reliable solutions that support and enhance the IT functions within Executive Branch Departments. The Office of Technology Services will work to increase the return on the State's investment in technology by promoting smart decision-making, solving problems intelligently, increasing the rate of project success, and fostering a skilled and professional staff. Serves as lead worker for the design, development, and implementation of change requests or applications. This includes the following activities: consults with functional analysts and other technical analysts, end-users and state agencies, or DOA management to identify and understand business requirements, processes, and rules and related legislative or regulatory requirements. translates business requirements into technical specifications, defines highly complex data elements and structure for databases, and determines and maintains security requirements develops and enforces application programming and development standards designs, codes, tests, and debugs highly complex programs to meet customers' business requirements works closely with customers during user acceptance testing provides documentation, problem analysis and training pertaining to technical design, operational requirements, and application or database integrity and maintenance. Supervises technical activities associated with supporting applications. Some of the tasks involved are: monitors growth of the data and initiates necessary maintenance activity schedules and directs execution of critical batch processes requiring monitoring and quick resolution investigates errors or problems that may occur serves as liaison between OTS Data Center Operations and analysts on system utilization, performance issues, and software and hardware upgrades monitors software life cycle, version obsolescence, system utilization, performance issues, software/hardware changes/issues, database changes/issues, server changes/issues, patches, hotfixes, etc. and provides maintenance as necessary. Serves as a technical expert on specific applications, which includes such activities as: answering highly complex questions pertaining to its programming or operation, and serving as a liaison to user agencies, OTS management and staff, and any vendor staff concerning application problems and issues. Provides lead support in analyzing and testing new enhancements and upgrades. This includes such things as: developing test plans, conducting and documenting tests, and evaluating and recording the results. Responsible for providing appropriate information to the other applicable OTS units, when necessary, in preparation for implementation of new releases or enhanced system capabilities. Provides lead worker support to Applications Developers on team. This includes such tasks as preparing work plans and schedules, assuring timely and successful completion of assignments, providing specialized training or assistance, and ensuring team procedures and application support standards are followed. Responsible for cross training/knowledge transfer in areas of expertise. Plans, coordinates, and conducts group meetings. This involves discussions concerning new releases, resolution of highly complex problems, potential change requests, and establishing priorities for system changes. Evaluates and recommends various software tools. Prepares specifications for customization of selected products to meet the specific needs of users/agencies. Performs all other tasks, special projects, analysis, studies, and plans as directed.
